pullRequest.body:
This PR ports the whole `compute_degree` tactic from mathlib3.

The tactic makes progress on goals of the form
*  `natDegree f â‰¤ d`,
*  `degree f â‰¤ d`,
*  `natDegree f = d`,
*  `degree f = d`,
*  `coeff f n = r`.

The variant `compute_degree!` applies `norm_num` and `assumption` to all left-over goals.

For instance, here is a valid computation of the degree of the 105-th cyclotomic polynomial:
```lean
example : natDegree
    (1 + X + X ^ 2 - X ^ 5 - X ^ 6 - 2 * X ^ 7 - X ^ 8 - X ^ 9 + X ^ 12 + X ^ 13 + X ^ 14 +
        X ^ 15 + X ^ 16 + X ^ 17 - X ^ 20 - X ^ 22 - X ^ 24 - X ^ 26 - X ^ 28 + X ^ 31 + X ^ 32 +
        X ^ 33 + X ^ 34 + X ^ 35 + X ^ 36 - X ^ 39 - X ^ 40 - 2 * X ^ 41 - X ^ 42 - X ^ 43 +
        X ^ 46 + X ^ 47 + X ^ 48 : â„¤[X]) = 48 := by
  compute_degree!
```
(Lean takes approximately 3s on my computer to prove the computation above.)

Affected files:
```
Mathlib/Lean/Expr/Basic.lean
Mathlib/Tactic/ComputeDegree.lean
test/ComputeDegree.lean
```

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#6220~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Kyle, thank you so much for taking the time to review the PR!

I've looked through your suggestions and I find them all great!  I hope to have time later today to sit at a computer and implement them.

I think this is in a good state now, and the user interface seems well-specified enough (with internals solid enough) that I'm happy to merge it. One thing we might want in the future is to have `compute_degree` be changed into a collection of `norm_num` extensions, with `compute_degree` in particular applying to the goals laid out in the docstring. One might even have `compute_degree` be a version of `norm_num` specialized to *just* `degree`/`natDegree`/`coeff` expressions and inequality goals involving them, letting it automatically compute degrees.

Anyway, the perfect is the enemy of the good, so

bors r+

Thanks for writing this tactic. There are some things I'd like to see changed before it is merged, and I've tested all these suggestions locally.
Thanks for writing this tactic. There are some things I'd like to see changed before it is merged, and I've tested all these suggestions locally.

Let's move this to `Mathlib.Lean.Expr.Basic`. Perhaps create a section called "recognizers"?

(One thing you should be able to do to save a few characters is ````let (type, _, lhs, rhs) â† p.app4? ``LE.le````, but this isn't so important.)
This was the only remaining move: done now!

The body of this function should be indented. If you wrap it in `Id.run do`, then you can make use of early return to make it a bit easier to read. For example:
```lean
def twoHeadsArgs (e : Expr) : Name Ã— Name Ã— Name Ã— List Bool := Id.run do
  let (eq_or_le, lhs, rhs) := match e.getAppFnArgs with
    | (na@``Eq, #[_, lhs, rhs])       => (na, lhs, rhs)
    | (na@``LE.le, #[_, _, lhs, rhs]) => (na, lhs, rhs)
    | (na, _) => (na, default)
  unless eq_or_le âˆˆ [``Eq, ``LE.le] do
    return (.anonymous, eq_or_le, lhs.getAppFn.constName, [])
  let (ndeg_or_deg_or_coeff, pol, and?) := match lhs.getAppFnArgs with
    | (na@``Polynomial.natDegree, #[_, _, pol]) => (na, pol, [rhs])
    | (na@``Polynomial.degree, #[_, _, pol])    => (na, pol, [rhs])
    | (na@``Polynomial.coeff, #[_, _, pol, c])  => (na, pol, [rhs, c])
    | (na@_, _) => (na, default)
  if pol == default then
    return (ndeg_or_deg_or_coeff, .anonymous, pol.getAppFn.constName, [])
  let head := match pol.numeral? with
    -- can I avoid the tri-splitting `n = 0`, `n = 1`, and generic `n`?
    | some 0 => `zero
    | some 1 => `one
    | some _ => `many
    | none => match pol.getAppFnArgs with
      | (``FunLike.coe, #[_, _, _, _, polFun, _]) => match polFun.getAppFnArgs with
        | (na@``Polynomial.monomial, _) => na
        | (na@``Polynomial.C, _) => na
        | _ => `error
      | (na, _) => na
  (ndeg_or_deg_or_coeff, eq_or_le, head, and?.map isMVar)
```
(Note: I used `getAppFn.constName` instead of `getAppFnArgs.1`.)

The way default values are used and having `zero`/`one`/`many` be special names are a bit sketchy. Suggestions will be in another comment.

Hmm, actually `lhs.getAppFnArgs.1` and `pol.getAppFnArgs.1` are pretty sketchy since `lhs` and `pol` are not anything meaningful in these cases.

Here's how I'd suggest organizing this function:
```lean
/-- `twoHeadsArgs e` takes an `Expr`ession `e` as input and recurses into `e` to make sure
the `e` looks like `lhs â‰¤ rhs` or `lhs = rhs` and that `lhs` is one of
`natDegree f, degree f, coeff f d`.
It returns
* the function being applied on the LHS (`natDegree`, `degree`, or `coeff`),
  or else `.anonymous` if it's none of these.
* the name of the relation (`Eq` or `LE.le`), or else `.anonymous` if it's none of these.
* either
  * `.inl zero`, `.inl one`, or `.inl many` if the polynomial in a numeral
  * or `.inr` of the the head symbol of `f`
  * or `.inl .anonymous` if inapplicable
* if it exists, whether the `rhs` is a metavariable
* if the LHS is `coeff f d`, whether `d` is a metavariable

This is all the data needed to figure out whether `compute_degree` can make progress on `e`
and, if so, which lemma it should apply.

Sample outputs:
* `natDegree (f + g) â‰¤ d => (natDegree, LE.le, HAdd.hAdd, d.isMVar, none)` (similarly for `=`);
* `degree (f * g) = d => (degree, Eq, HMul.hMul, d.isMVar, none)` (similarly for `â‰¤`);
* `coeff (1 : â„•[X]) c = x => (coeff, Eq, one, x.isMVar, c.isMVar)` (no `â‰¤` option!).
-/
def twoHeadsArgs (e : Expr) : Name Ã— Name Ã— Sum Name Name Ã— List Bool := Id.run do
  let (eq_or_le, lhs, rhs) â† match e.getAppFnArgs with
    | (na@``Eq, #[_, lhs, rhs])       => pure (na, lhs, rhs)
    | (na@``LE.le, #[_, _, lhs, rhs]) => pure (na, lhs, rhs)
    | _ => return (.anonymous, .anonymous, .inl .anonymous, [])
  let (ndeg_or_deg_or_coeff, pol, and?) â† match lhs.getAppFnArgs with
    | (na@``Polynomial.natDegree, #[_, _, pol]) => (na, pol, [rhs.isMVar])
    | (na@``Polynomial.degree, #[_, _, pol])    => (na, pol, [rhs.isMVar])
    | (na@``Polynomial.coeff, #[_, _, pol, c])  => (na, pol, [rhs.isMVar, c.isMVar])
    | _ => return (.anonymous, eq_or_le, .inl .anonymous, [])
  let head := match pol.numeral? with
    -- can I avoid the tri-splitting `n = 0`, `n = 1`, and generic `n`?
    | some 0 => .inl `zero
    | some 1 => .inl `one
    | some _ => .inl `many
    | none => match pol.getAppFnArgs with
      | (``FunLike.coe, #[_, _, _, _, polFun, _]) =>
        let na := polFun.getAppFn.constName
        if na âˆˆ [``Polynomial.monomial, ``Polynomial.C] then
          .inr na
        else
          .inl .anonymous
      | (na, _) => .inr na
  (ndeg_or_deg_or_coeff, eq_or_le, head, and?)
```
Very nice!  I like `Id.run do` and `Sum Name Name`!

Indentation:
```suggestion
def getCongrLemma (twoH : Name Ã— Name Ã— List Bool) (debug : Bool := false) : Name :=
  let nam := match twoH with
    | (_,           ``LE.le, [rhs]) => if rhs then ``id else ``le_trans
    | (``natDegree, ``Eq, [rhs])    => if rhs then ``id else ``natDegree_eq_of_le_of_coeff_ne_zero'
    | (``degree,    ``Eq, [rhs])    => if rhs then ``id else ``degree_eq_of_le_of_coeff_ne_zero'
    | (``coeff,     ``Eq, [rhs, c]) =>
      match rhs, c with
      | false, false => ``coeff_congr
      | false, true  => ``Eq.trans
      | true, false  => ``coeff_congr_lhs
      | true, true   => ``id
    | _ => ``id
  if debug then
    let natr := if nam.getString == `trans then nam else nam.getString
    dbg_trace f!"congr lemma: '{natr}'"
    nam
  else
    nam
```

To make it accept the changes made to `twoHeadArgs`, and some changes to improve robustness.
```suggestion
def dispatchLemma
    (twoH : Name Ã— Name Ã— Sum Name Name Ã— List Bool) (debug : Bool := false) : Name :=
  match twoH with
    | (.anonymous, _, _) => ``id -- `twoH` gave default value, so we do nothing
    | (_, .anonymous, _) => ``id -- `twoH` gave default value, so we do nothing
    | (na1, na2, head, bools) =>
      let msg := f!"\ndispatchLemma:\n  {head}"
      -- if there is some non-metavariable on the way, we "congr" it away
      if false âˆˆ bools then getCongrLemma (na1, na2, bools) debug
      else
      -- otherwise, we select either the first, second or third element of the triple in `nas` below
      let Ï€ (natDegLE : Name) (degLE : Name) (coeff : Name) : Name := Id.run do
        let lem := match na1, na2 with
          | ``natDegree, ``LE.le => natDegLE
          | ``degree, ``LE.le => degLE
          | ``coeff, ``Eq => coeff
          | _, ``LE.le => ``le_rfl
          | _, _ => ``rfl
        if debug then
          dbg_trace f!"{lem.getString}\n{msg}"
        lem
      match head with
        | .inl `zero => Ï€ ``natDegree_zero_le ``degree_zero_le ``coeff_zero
        | .inl `one => Ï€ ``natDegree_one_le ``degree_one_le ``coeff_one
        | .inl `many => Ï€ ``natDegree_nat_cast_le ``degree_nat_cast_le ``coeff_nat_cast_ite
        | .inl .anonymous => Ï€ ``le_rfl ``le_rfl ``rfl
        | .inr ``HAdd.hAdd =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_add_le_of_le ``degree_add_le_of_le ``coeff_add_of_eq
        | .inr ``HSub.hSub =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_sub_le_of_le ``degree_sub_le_of_le ``coeff_sub_of_eq
        | .inr ``HMul.hMul =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_mul_le_of_le ``degree_mul_le_of_le ``coeff_mul_add_of_le_natDegree_of_eq_ite
        | .inr ``HPow.hPow =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_pow_le_of_le ``degree_pow_le_of_le ``coeff_pow_of_natDegree_le_of_eq_ite'
        | .inr ``Neg.neg =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_neg_le_of_le ``degree_neg_le_of_le ``coeff_neg
        | .inr ``Polynomial.X =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_X_le ``degree_X_le ``coeff_X
        | .inr ``Nat.cast =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_nat_cast_le ``degree_nat_cast_le ``coeff_nat_cast_ite
        | .inr ``NatCast.natCast =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_nat_cast_le ``degree_nat_cast_le ``coeff_nat_cast_ite
        | .inr ``Int.cast =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_int_cast_le ``degree_int_cast_le ``coeff_int_cast_ite
        | .inr ``IntCast.intCast =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_int_cast_le ``degree_int_cast_le ``coeff_int_cast_ite
        | .inr ``Polynomial.monomial =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_monomial_le ``degree_monomial_le ``coeff_monomial
        | .inr ``Polynomial.C =>
          Ï€ ``natDegree_C_le ``degree_C_le ``coeff_C
        | _ => Ï€ ``le_rfl ``le_rfl ``rfl
```

Need to make sure to instantiate metavariables:
```suggestion
  let (yesMV, noMV) := â† mvs.partitionM fun mv =>
                          return hasExprMVar (â† instantiateMVars (â† mv.getDecl).type)
```

Indentation:
```suggestion
def splitApply (mvs static : List MVarId) : MetaM ((List MVarId) Ã— (List MVarId)) := do
  let (can_progress, curr_static) := â† mvs.partitionM fun mv => do
    return dispatchLemma (twoHeadsArgs (â† mv.getType'')) != ``id
  let progress := â† can_progress.mapM fun mv => do
    let lem := dispatchLemma <| twoHeadsArgs (â† mv.getType'')
    mv.applyConst <| lem
  return (progress.join, static ++ curr_static)
```

Let's not use a debug flag. Instead let's us the standard interface of a trace option.
```suggestion
syntax (name := computeDegree) "compute_degree" "!"? : tactic

initialize registerTraceClass `Tactic.compute_degree
```

1. This removes the debug flag and switches to using `trace[Tactic.compute_degree]`
2. This switches to `let goal â† getMainGoal` notation in a few places instead of `let goal := â† getMainGoal`
3. The two error cases in the `match` seemed backwards. I also removed mentioning the head symbol since a user can see it from the goal state easily enough (and it's wrong to mention `.anonymous` if there's no head symbol). Note the `{""}` trick for continuing an `m!` string.
4. The `while` can use `!=`
5. There was a missing `withMainContext` around the whole `do` expression, which is needed for `getType''`
6. The tag-based goal matching when assembling the miscomputed degree error message wasn't robust, so I changed it to something that is guaranteed to work.
```suggestion
elab_rules : tactic | `(tactic| compute_degree $[!%$bang]?) => focus <| withMainContext do
  let goal â† getMainGoal
  let gt â† goal.getType''
  let deg? := match gt.eq? with
    | some (_, _, rhs) => some rhs
    | _ => none
  let twoH := twoHeadsArgs gt
  match twoH with
    | (_, .anonymous, _) => throwError
        (m!"'compute_degree' inapplicable. The goal{indentD gt}\nis expected to be 'â‰¤' or '='.")
    | (.anonymous, _, _) => throwError
        (m!"'compute_degree' inapplicable. The LHS must be an application of {
          ""}'natDegree', 'degree', or 'coeff'.")
    | _ =>
      let lem := dispatchLemma twoH
      trace[Tactic.compute_degree] f!"'compute_degree' first applies lemma '{lem.getString}'"
      let mut (gls, static) := (â† goal.applyConst lem, [])
      while gls != [] do (gls, static) â† splitApply gls static
      let rfled â† try_rfl static
      setGoals rfled
      --  simplify the left-hand sides, since this is where the degree computations leave
      --  expressions such as `max (0 * 1) (max (1 + 0 + 3 * 4) (7 * 0))`
      evalTactic
        (â† `(tactic| try any_goals conv_lhs => (simp only [Nat.cast_withBot]; norm_num)))
      if bang.isSome then
        let mut false_goals : Array MVarId := #[]
        let mut new_goals : Array MVarId := #[]
        for g in â† getGoals do
          let gs' â† run g do evalTactic (â† `(tactic| try (any_goals norm_num <;> try assumption)))
          new_goals := new_goals ++ gs'.toArray
          if â† gs'.anyM fun g' => g'.withContext do return (â† g'.getType'').isConstOf ``False then
            false_goals := false_goals.push g
        setGoals new_goals.toList
        if let some deg := deg? then
          let errors := miscomputedDegree? deg (â† false_goals.mapM (MVarId.getType'' Â·)).toList
          unless errors.isEmpty do
            throwError Lean.MessageData.joinSep
              (m!"The given degree is '{deg}'.  However,\n" :: errors) "\n"
```

Somehow this gets reordered with the changes
```suggestion
* the coefficient of degree 0 may be zero
* there is at least one term of naÃ¯ve degree 2
* there may be a term of naÃ¯ve degree 2
```

Generally tactics don't insert all these extra newlines, which is why I removed them.
```suggestion
error: 'compute_degree' inapplicable. The goal
  natDegree X â‰  0
is expected to be 'â‰¤' or '='.
```

```suggestion
error: 'compute_degree' inapplicable. The LHS must be an application of 'natDegree', 'degree', or 'coeff'.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: tactic `compute_degree`

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: simple lemmas about polynomials and their degrees
